lineFollowerSim

Class Sensors

  • java.lang.Object
    • lineFollowerSim.Sensors

  • public class Sensors
extends java.lang.Object
    Single instance of Sensors provides access to both spot and line sensor lists created by LFS for the purpose of iterating over all defined sensors to acquire sensor intensity data from the robots current location and heading on a line following course image.
    Author:
    Ron Grant

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<LineSensor> lineSensorList
      LineSensor list, contains all instances of LineSensor objects created by LFS method createLineSensor.
      boolean sensorImageRead 
      java.util.ArrayList<SpotSensor> spotSensorList
      SpotSensor list, contains all instances of SpotSensor objects created by LFS method createSpotSensor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void lineSensorSpotLocationCalc(LineSensor ls, int index, PVector result)
      This method is called for each line sensor index from 0 to sensor spot count -1, where it calculates robot relative coordinates of each spot based on sensor location, arcRadius and rotation parameters.
      void lineSensorSpotLocationCalcInit(LineSensor ls)
      Used in conjunction with lineSensorSpotLocationCalc used to determine location of individual spot x,y offsets within a line sensor taking into account rotation and/or half circle mode (non-zero arcRadius).
      void nameSensorsUsingVariableNames()
      Iterate through defined sensors and assign their variable name to their name.

    • Field Detail

      • spotSensorList

        public java.util.ArrayList<SpotSensor> spotSensorList
        SpotSensor list, contains all instances of SpotSensor objects created by LFS method createSpotSensor.

        This list is user accessible in allowing iteration through defined line sensors.

        For example: for (SpotSensor ss : lfs.sensors.spotSensorList) println (ss.getXoff(),ss.getYoff(),ss.read());

      • lineSensorList

        public java.util.ArrayList<LineSensor> lineSensorList
        LineSensor list, contains all instances of LineSensor objects created by LFS method createLineSensor.

        This list is user accessible allowing iteration through defined line sensors.

        For Example: for (LineSensor ls : lfs.sensors.lineSensorList) println (ls.getXoff(),ls.getYoff());

      • sensorImageRead

        public boolean sensorImageRead

    • Method Detail

      • lineSensorSpotLocationCalcInit

        public void lineSensorSpotLocationCalcInit(LineSensor ls)
        Used in conjunction with lineSensorSpotLocationCalc used to determine location of individual spot x,y offsets within a line sensor taking into account rotation and/or half circle mode (non-zero arcRadius). An example use is to display sensor spots with colors(s) that indicate user set thresholds, i.e. turning line sensor spots RED where a line is perceived or other colors where a stain might be perceived.
        Parameters:
        ls - reference to line sensor

      • lineSensorSpotLocationCalc

        public void lineSensorSpotLocationCalc(LineSensor ls,
                                       int index,
                                       PVector result)
        This method is called for each line sensor index from 0 to sensor spot count -1, where it calculates robot relative coordinates of each spot based on sensor location, arcRadius and rotation parameters. Main use is to simplify display of line sensor data after user has added interpretation of raw sensor data.
        Parameters:
        ls - Reference to line sensor
        index - Current index from 0 to sensor cell (spot) count -1
        result - PVector containing x,y offset with respect to robot

      • nameSensorsUsingVariableNames

        public void nameSensorsUsingVariableNames()
        Iterate through defined sensors and assign their variable name to their name. This is used to ID sensors when mouse hovering over robot/sensor view. This method is called in UserInit tab after defining all sensor instances.
